intro: Amblyanthera cuyabensis, commonly known as the Cuyabeno amblyanthera, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments along riverbanks and in dense undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
